projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
While testing Window Acceptance I notised that the  text of a "Close Window 2" button moves and flashes on a bottom of the screen after the button was pressed and disappeared.

Not a regression, the behavior exists on 2.0.1 as well.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Run Application Titanium.UI.Window Acceptance TIMOB-7694. 
2. Press 'Open Window 2' button. 
3. Press 'Close Window 2' button. 

Expected result:
App should not crash.

Actual Result:
see Attachment
fields.summary: Android: TI.UI.Window  - v8:  text of the button flashes on the screen after button pressed and dismissed
fields.environment:
Titanium Studio, build: 2.0.3.201205250852
Titanium SDK: 2.0.2.v20120525161324
Device: Nexus One 2.2.2

Closing as cannot reproduce
